images.caption: Barneynagappul Strand. Although an island, Achill is easily accessible by road via the Michael Davitt Bridge. It’s a strong Irish-speaking region with breathtaking scenery, beaches and villages.

images.title: Foreshore beside Blacksod Bay by John Lucas, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Foreshore beside Blacksod Bay. Characterised by its rugged mountains and expansive peat bogs, the island is renowned for its towering sea cliffs and pristine beaches. Its windswept coastline attracts enthusiasts of various water sports. The picturesque Keem Bay, with its sweeping strand, has captivated visiting writers such as Heinrich Böll and Graham Greene. Additionally, the main village of Keel boasts a sandy beach popular among surfers.

description: This circular walk explores a beautiful part of Achill Island in County Mayo. The waymarked trail follows the Valley Loop around the north eastern part of the island for a distance of about 8.5km. It's a fairly flat hike with wonderful views over the Atlantic Ocean and the nearby Slievemore mountain. There's also a nice sandy beach and a series of pretty lakes. You can continue your walking on the island by heading west to the Dooagh Loop Walk. There's more great views over the horseshoe-shaped Keem Bay, the Dingle peninsula and the surrounding Achill mountains on this trail.
